problem_statement: The project GridBound utilizes a custom A-Star pathfinding implementation for NPC navigation. Recent QA reports indicate that NPCs become unresponsive when navigating near zero-cost Teleporter tiles or when boxed into corners. Additionally, performance logs suggest that the paths generated are not always the shortest possible distance, implying an issue with the heuristic admissibility or the priority queue management. You must deliver a robust Jest test suite that deterministically identifies these logical failures within the existing codebase.
FAIL_TO_PASS: A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_infinite_loop_on_zero_cost > should handle zero-cost tile when start equals end on that tile
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_infinite_loop_on_zero_cost > should complete within 200ms for simple grid navigation
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_infinite_loop_on_zero_cost > should complete within 200ms for larger grid
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_unreachable_target > should find path when obstacles create narrow passage
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_unreachable_target > should find path around walls
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_unreachable_target > should navigate maze-like structure
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_suboptimal_path_detection > should find optimal path preferring grass over water
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_suboptimal_path_detection > should choose shorter weighted path over longer cheap path
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_suboptimal_path_detection > should detect when path is not optimal due to heuristic issues
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_start_equals_end > should return single element array when start equals end
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_start_equals_end > should return single element for corner position when start equals end
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_start_equals_end > should handle start equals end on high-cost tile
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_path_continuity > should have consecutive points with distance of exactly 1
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_path_continuity > should maintain continuity around obstacles
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_path_continuity > should not skip tiles or teleport
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_state_isolation > should not pollute state between sequential searches
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_state_isolation > should produce identical results for identical inputs on repeated calls
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_state_isolation > should not affect grid after search
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_boundary_conditions > should handle 1x1 grid
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_boundary_conditions > should handle edge path along top boundary
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_boundary_conditions > should handle edge path along left boundary
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_boundary_conditions > should handle narrow corridor (1 tile wide)
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > test_boundary_conditions > should handle path along perimeter
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > toMatchPathCost helper function > should correctly calculate path cost for simple path
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > toMatchPathCost helper function > should correctly calculate path cost for weighted path
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > toMatchPathCost helper function > should handle single point path with zero cost
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > toMatchPathCost helper function > should fail for incorrect cost
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > toMatchPathCost helper function > should handle path with varied weight tiles
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > Performance Tests > should complete pathfinding on 20x20 grid within reasonable time
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > Performance Tests > should handle 20x20 grid with obstacles that have path
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > Performance Tests > should handle 20x20 grid with varied weights
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > Edge Cases > should handle very high weight tiles
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > Edge Cases > should handle rectangular grid (non-square)
A-Star Pathfinding Tests > Edge Cases > should handle tall rectangular grid
